data.title: Inner glow effect for READY cells
data.body:
Check the IRC logs of today (~ 08:12). http://logs.ihptru.net/
We talked about adding an inner (white) glow for the cell that displays the READY text.

Here is how it looks like, ingame (8px glow, white 66% opacity): 
![79154740-f09b-11e3-9698-c3f3bd8d00d9](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3229892/20ad83a0-f09c-11e3-84b7-339ed9a23c14.png)

data.title: Removing requirement to restart game after applying changes to mouse focus option
data.body: I have removed the requirement for the game to be restarted after applying changes to the 'lock mouse to window' option in the 'Input' tab of the settings menu. I had to add a bit of plumbing between IGraphicsDevice and SettingsLogic to achieve this.

data.title: Fixed crash when OpenGL version parse fails
data.body: and dump more useful information for us in the graphics.log file.

data.title: Crash when parsing unexpected (bogus?) GL version.
data.body:
Reported at http://cnc-comm.com/community/index.php?topic=2976.0.

```
System.IndexOutOfRangeException: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
   at OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2.ErrorHandler.CheckGlVersion()
   at OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2.Sdl2GraphicsDevice..ctor(Size windowSize, WindowMode windowMode)
   at OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2.DeviceFactory.Create(Size size, WindowMode windowMode)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.CreateDevice(Assembly rendererDll, Int32 width, Int32 height, WindowMode window)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.Initialize(WindowMode windowMode)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
```

We need to verify that `version.Length == 2` before indexing it, and we may also need to deal with integer number versions(?).

data.title: UI elements don't display proper state on creation
data.body: Example, from the main menu click Extras. The Credits button will appear under the mouse. Until the mouse is moved the state of the button will be as if in a non-mouseover state.

data.title: Expanded credits window a bit
data.body: Text was pushing the right margin, eased it up a bit.

data.title: Repair/Rearm activities have bogus checks.
data.body:
Rearm checks RepairBuildings.
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.RA/Activities/Rearm.cs#L46

Repair checks RearmBuildings.
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.RA/Activities/Repair.cs#L39

I'm pretty sure those should be swapped.

The RearmBuildings logic from Aircraft should be generalized into LimitedAmmo (which should come as part of this).

RepairBuildings from Aircraft should probably be pulled out into its own trait `Repairable` with a property by the name of `RepairBuildings string[]` which would be checked against by the Repair activity.

data.title: LAG when units are stuck
data.body:
First of all, thank you for recreating the game i loved a decade ago :)

There seems to be a problem with units getting stuck causing lag. When i play this with a friend, the game sometimes gets really slow. I usually ask if the other party has some units stuck, and when he moves them, the games runs normal again. 

It is a minor inconvenience, and easily fixed by moving units. However i of course can't ask the AI the same question, which is why the games almost halts when i play against AI. 

Units are stuck when you give them an order to move, but other units or buildings block are in the way. It seems that the unit won't stop trying to get out.

The task manager usually shows that OpenRA is using about 10% of the CPU. When a few units get stuck, then the CPU uses weirdly drops to below 5%. It is actually using less CPU.

I think this problem could be fixed if the behavior of units is changed or if the order is canceled after X amount of time when there is no way to get to the destination. 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2577870-lag-when-units-are-stuck?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add support for mouse grabs.
data.body:
Added call to SDL_CreateWindow on game initialisation.

To allow for situations (such as development) where the user does not wish OpenRA to grab the window focus, this functionality is configurable in the 'Display' settings menu.

data.title: Add support for using 32-bit RGBA sprites instead of SHPs
data.body:
PNG would be the most sensible choice, I think.

Similar to #5075, but for hi-color/true color.

data.title: Configurable map scrolling buttons
data.body:
I think the "Middel-Mouse Scrolling" option should be removed and replaced with a configurable map scrolling option. Some games use the right mouse button for scrolling, my personal favorite but other players may have other preferences that are not met with just a use or don't use option.
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/3212077/0420d804-ef43-11e3-92a2-76958bb7f894.png)

data.title: Add support for playing ogg/vorbis sounds
data.body:
This works but is not optimal; the current sound system leaves a lot to be desired.

This only works for sounds (not music). See [this](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/mods/d2k/notifications.yaml#L36).

Someone familiar with OpenAL should really redo the sound system with proper interfaces for the sound loaders.

See also:  #5491

data.title: Captured enemies/neutral Factories/Barracks won't update their units building prequesites.
data.body:
Release 20140608
Was testing a map mod that I'm making over time and noticed that:
-When I captured a factory and the owner of it hadn't had a the building needed to satisfy the prequerisites it would not let me build that unit even with needed building to make it possible.
The opposite also applies:
-If I capture an enemy's factory/barracks and that enemy has the building needed to build the actor X, it will let me build it even if I don't have the required building.

Before I considered to post here, I made a test to make sure it was a bug and it is. The problem is that I don't even know if this is intended or not.
http://resource.openra.net/maps/1025
I choosed GDI to test it.

data.title: Fixed C4 target inconsistencies with Fog of War and Husks
data.body: Closes #5566

data.title: Sniper Unit: Adding standing firing frames & Voice
data.body:
Using the flame-trooper as a template to create the sniper unit, the "standing" firing frames were never created for the sniper unit since it was established that the sniper would always "prone" fire. Now, this isn't the case, as the Sniper unit fires standing up, but the standing firing frames need to be added. 

Also, the sniper unit currently uses GenericVoice, maybe it would be a good idea to distinguish selecting/ordering a sniper unit with a different voice than that of the typical e1,e3, etc.

Edit: Firing frames are added, also added in some "reloading" frames for the sniper in between shots.

![comparison](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1801219/3210144/7b21b3b8-eea5-11e3-8a6b-ed6c7211d930.png)
## <bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Dont queue rallypoint move if MoveIntoWorld:false.
data.body: Fixes #5576.

data.title: RA Aircraft take off immediately after production.
data.body: Regression introduced by #5476.  Aircraft should only take off if the production structure defines a rallypoint (like the helipads).

data.title: Always show primary tag
data.body:
This implements #4935, although the wording in that issue is not correct. This commit shows primary tag on production buildings always if it is set, not only when the building is selected. Airfield has a separate tag position because of overlapping of progress bars. I experimented with different locations and I think this results in least overlapping. Airfield also has a different tag position if pixel doubling is enabled. I couldn't have done this commit without the help of WolfGaming in #openra. I tested the commit and seems to work.

I removed DrawTags method from SelectionDecorations.cs because its only purpose was to draw the primary tag which is now done in PrimaryBuilding.cs.

data.title: playtest-20140607 mod.yaml version bug
data.body: Version: playtest-20140607^0

data.title: Fixed pixel doubling and health bar hotkeys unavailable in spectator mode
data.body: as described in #5572. This was not intended.

data.title: Hotkeys [double pixeling, health bars] unavailable for spectators & replay viewing.
data.body:
As a spec/replay viewer you can switch between all player's views and worldview with hotkeys which are listed on the menu's 'Input Tab' under Observer Commands (toggling single player/team's view is not listed but is set to '0' or '=').

Hotkeys such as 'Enable double pixeling' and toggle health bars are listed under Global Command and are unavailable for specs/replay viewing. This is a minor tweak but can be a very convenient feature for the observer.

data.title: Fixed single resources being spawned at 0 density
data.body:
and therefore not being rendered as described in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5565. Haos Ridges is a good test case (even without https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496) because it comes with spots showing few gems.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/3208269/45a24510-ee26-11e3-9028-6a8ecf57e26f.png)

data.title: Fix arch packaging (attempt two).
Fix arch packaging.
data.body:
This brings the Travis packaging to parity with build.open-ra.org.
- Tested locally, but not on Travis.
- Will require a website change for the .xz -> .gz filename change.
